page.title: 14WHITGREAVE A LOCAL VILLAGE.
page.content: because of a total lack of public transport locally.Few people use trains regularly or at all,though there are regular services from Stone and Stefford,which are no more than six miles away. Most homes have television,a refrigerator,a freezer,a washing machine and a telephone but only 4 had a home computer.Athird of the households grow some of their vegetables:a similar number grow none. A large of pets are kept,ranging from pigeons to ponies,and cats to guinea pigs.Half the peoplehad had no holiday last year,though 4 had had 2.Seven had been abroad.For shopping,Stafford was the most popular centre,there being no village shop. Allso lacking are a pub,a school or any club building.
